author: Staff Reporter
text:
Government vehicles used by chairpersons of local bodies were surrendered to the district election officer as per the model code of conduct. Vehicles lined up on the premises of the Collector's office.- Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

As per the model code of conduct, elected representatives have to surrender vehicles allotted to them by the government to the district election officer. Accordingly, chairpersons of local bodies have handed over the vehicles to officials.

Officials said 20 government vehicles allotted to chairpersons of local bodies in the district were surrendered to the district election officer on Saturday.

These vehicles, which were lined up on the premises of the Collector’s office on Tuesday, would be allotted for election-related works, if required, to tahsildars.

Similarly, elected representatives are required to hand over the keys of government buildings allotted to them to officials.

While Members of Legislative Assembly should hand over the keys of their offices to Public Works Department officials, the offices of local body representatives came under the control of block development officers, an official said.

As per rules, government buildings should not be utilised by political parties for election campaigns, or for political party meetings or for any other election-related works.
title: Vehicles surrendered to election officer
